p: Dragonflies are apex predators in the freshwater insect realm, and offer important ecological services such as biological pest control, particularly where disease vectors such as mosquitoes are abundant [ 101, 112]. Dragonflies may also cause disservices by feeding on important pollinators in urban and suburban settings [ 113, 114, 115]. As a result, they have a significant influence on freshwater trophic interactions and energy flows between terrestrial and aquatic environments [ 116]. However, little empirical information is available on shifts in trophic flows in response to urbanization [ 59].
